tool_description: Constructs formatted chargeback dispute responses with evidence attachments for submission to card networks.

reason_code.description: Chargeback reason code from card network

evidence_package_id.description: Evidence package identifier from evidence collector

response_strategy.description: Response approach: accept_liability, dispute_with_evidence, or partial_refund

merchant_statement.description: Custom merchant statement for the response

card_network.description: Card network: visa, mastercard, amex, or discover

auto_submit.description: Whether to automatically submit the response

liability_shift_request.description: Whether to request liability shift to issuer

priority_level.description: Processing priority: low, normal, or high

error_messages: Evidence package not found: The evidence_package_id does not exist or is not accessible. Verify the package ID and ensure evidence collection completed successfully.
Invalid response strategy: Use one of [accept_liability, dispute_with_evidence, partial_refund]. Ensure the strategy aligns with available evidence strength.
Deadline passed: The submission_deadline has already passed. Chargeback responses cannot be submitted after the deadline.
Unsupported card network: Use one of [visa, mastercard, amex, discover]. Verify the card_network parameter matches the chargeback source.
Insufficient evidence: The selected evidence package lacks required documentation for the chosen response_strategy. Collect additional evidence or adjust strategy.
usage: Provide chargeback_id, reason_code, evidence_package_id, response_strategy, submission_deadline, and card_network to build dispute responses. Optionally include merchant_statement and configure auto_submit preferences.

response_id.description: Unique identifier for the generated response

formatted_response.description: Complete formatted response ready for submission

submission_status.description: Response status: draft, ready, submitted, or rejected

win_probability.description: Estimated probability of successful dispute resolution (0-1)
